issue.title: "Autosize" union type accepts string formatted number
issue.body:
@chriswmackey 
Currently, those autosizable parameters accepts either number or string, but it should be only accepting "autosize"/"autocalculate" if the input is string. In current schema design, a string formatted number is also accepted, but it could potentially cause a problem.

body:
Thank you for the response @samuelcolvin . It's unfortunately going to be at least a couple of months before we can delve into the pydantic source code and attempt a fix. If anyone else is able to tackle it in before then, it would be a huge help.

And, if other users experience this same issue, hopefully they will find this post and see that they can use `schema_extra` as a workaround for the time being.

https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/blob/645e5fe6a0c74c95c24410571e9bb804af3eb677/pydantic/schema.py#L693-L696

Given that a length-one-allOf is always a no-op, this branch doesn't actually do anything and skimming the history back to d73aa1bded92efbab48832c9589391b9c1b4d17c it looks like it has never been necessary (except for the test checking that the result contains `allOf`, of course).

So it's a good first issue to unconditionally `return schema_ref, definitions, nested_models` and fix the test ðŸ˜„
@tiangolo I guess you first implemented this, any idea why it's there?

issue.title: Missing Any of type in AirBoundaryConstruction
fix(face type): add default for face type #98
Remove extra allOf keys in schema

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution! -->
<!-- Unless your change is trivial, please create an issue to discuss the change before creating a PR -->
<!-- See https://pydantic-docs.helpmanual.io/contributing/ for help on Contributing -->

## Change Summary

<!-- Please give a short summary of the changes. -->
The current implementation of `schema` returns multiple `allOf`s inside `anyOf` when `Union` is used in combination with `Field`. It will work fine with no `Union` which is what is currently included in all the tests.

To address the issue I only collect the referenced object when the schema is generated for a case with multiple sub-fileds and overwrite is True.

See #1209 for a more detailed explanation of the problem.

## Related issue number
resolves #1209

## Checklist

* [x] Unit tests for the changes exist
* [x] Tests pass on CI and coverage remains at 100%
* [x] Documentation reflects the changes where applicable
* [x] `changes/<pull request or issue id>-<github username>.md` file added describing change
  (see [changes/README.md](https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/blob/master/changes/README.md) for details)

issue.title: fix(helper): handle case where type is in an `anyOf` key
